module.name: scimport
module.description: Forward messages across two SeisComP3 systems.

parameter.name: sink
parameter.description: Address of scmaster to sent imported messages to.

parameter.name: msggroups
parameter.description: Defines a list of message groups of the source system (connection.server). If not specified the source system is queried for a list of message groups which are then used to check each subscription extracted from the routing table. This parameter allows to override to source query result.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Defines the pick status to filter for. Allowed values are "automatic", "manual" and "*".

parameter.name: phase
parameter.description: Defines the pick phase hint to filter for. Allowed values are all possible phase codes and "*"

parameter.name: agencyID
parameter.description: Defines the pick agencyID to filter for. Allowed values are all possible agency ids and "*"

parameter.name: networkCode
parameter.description: Defines the pick network code of the processed waveforms. Allowed values are all possible network codes and "*"

parameter.name: operator
parameter.description: Defines the amplitude comparison operator. Allowed values are "eq", "lt", "gt" and "*".

parameter.name: amplitude
parameter.description: Defines the amplitude threshold to filter for. The operator configured with "operator" is used to compare this threshold with the incoming value. If "operator" is "*" then values will pass.

parameter.name: agencyID
parameter.description: Defines the amplitude agencyID to filter for. Allowed values are all possible agency ids and "*"

struct.description: A sink definition used for either import or export.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: Defining filter criteria name for sink, e.g. criteria = world-xxl. The criteria must be defined in the criteria.*.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Enables/disables filtering based on defined criteria. If set to false and even a criteria is defined, all events will pass.

parameter.name: routingTable
parameter.description: Defining routing tables in the meaning of mapping objects to message groups. E.g. Pick:NULL, StationAmplitude:NULL, Origin:LOCATION, StationMagnitude: MAGNITUDE, NetworkMagnitude:MAGNITUDE, MagnitudeReference:MAGNITUDE, OriginReference:EVENT, Event:EVENT.

option.description: Switch to import mode (default is relay). Im import mode the routing table has to be specified whereas in relay the routing table will be calculated automatically.
Route unknown groups to the default group IMPORT_GROUP.
